title: Currently in silver 4 playing on a 2007 aldi laptop. Anyone else have similar specs to mine?
body:
If you do what rank are you? I am having a hard time playing adc role as i am constantly on 50 fps and drop to 10 fps in teamfights.
I will almost die too much but i think that half my deaths are partially due to fps and constantly high pings.

replies.body:
Some shitty sony viao thats pink and takes 10 minutes to startup.

Nuff said
What rank are you ? just curious.

> [{quoted}](name=tisla,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=IpEGyE4k,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-07-03T00:47:10.069+0000)
>
> What rank are you ? just curious.

A b3 scrublord.

I am quite similar to you, although I'm in diamond. 

I spent like 6 hours straight trying anything to improve fps and I ended up also changing my task manager priorities when I start a game and making LoL client a high priority which seemed to fix it. If I had anything else like Spotify open I would lower that priority as well. I mained adc to diamond~

Thanks for the idea. once I go in-game I will be sure to set it to high priority in task manager. How on earth can you main adc on a shitty laptop. I never play adc as the lagginess is unbearable when csing early and making plays in the bot lane. I might have to though because if you look at my match history, the neemy bot lanes gets 2 double kills within the first 5 mins. Dropped from 70 LP to -1LP.

I'm a Silver1 'fill' main, which generally means support and sometimes top or jungle. I'm playing on a literal tablet (not a laptop) which shouldn't really be running the windows 10 OS but whatever.

I feel ya, but I play tanks like nautilus, leona, sion, alistair, ect... in teamfights, which is generally alot easier so long as you manage your general positioning (rather than the adaptive positioning of an adc to avoid getting splatted by a syndra or zed); or I play utility supports like zilean, janna and lulu, who are really safe and I try to position as aggressively as I can when playing these champs.

I don't think my setup holds me back very much because in all honesty my mechanics would probably be terrible anyway on a good setup. I just need to be more calm and considerate of my macroplay because I know what I'm supposed to be doing but I often fail to act on that.
